That's fantastic! You're already taking great steps to increase your physical activity. Here are some additional suggestions to help you stay active throughout the day:

1. **Take the stairs**: If you work or live in a building with stairs, opt for taking the stairs instead of the elevator. This can add up to a great workout throughout the day.
2. **Desk exercises**: Try doing chair squats, desk push-ups, or leg lifts while sitting at your desk. You can also do wrist extensions and finger spreads to reduce the risk of carpal tunnel syndrome.
3. **Walk to a coworker's desk**: Instead of sending an email or instant message, walk to a coworker's desk to chat with them. This can help you get up and move around more often.
4. **Park farther away**: When you're out and about, try parking your car in a spot that's farther away from your destination. This will give you more opportunities to walk and get some extra steps in.
5. **Take a walk during phone calls**: If you have a phone call that doesn't require your full attention, try taking a walk while you chat. This can help you stay active and focused.
6. **Do household chores**: Turn housework into a workout by putting on some music and increasing your intensity. You can also try doing squats or lunges while you vacuum or mop.
7. **Take a walking meeting**: If possible, suggest a walking meeting with your colleagues or friends. This can be a great way to get some exercise while still being productive.
8. **Use a fitness tracker**: Wear a fitness tracker to track your daily steps and set daily step goals for yourself. This can help motivate you to move more throughout the day.
9. **Take breaks to stretch**: Take short breaks throughout the day to stretch your muscles. This can help reduce the risk of injury and improve your overall flexibility.
10. **Try active commuting**: If possible, try commuting to work or school by bike, bus, or train. This can help you get some exercise while also reducing your carbon footprint.
11. **Play with your kids**: If you have kids, play active games with them, such as tag, hide-and-seek, or soccer. This can be a great way to get some exercise while spending quality time with your family.
12. **Take a fitness class during lunch**: Look for fitness classes or studios near your work that offer lunchtime classes. This can be a great way to fit in a workout during your break.

Remember, every bit counts, and increasing your physical activity can have numerous health benefits. Keep up the great work, and don't be afraid to get creative and find ways to stay active that work best for you!
